rev.comment: /* Men and feminism */ ref to antifeminists is not actually about men - therefore rmv
/* Feminism around the world */ using {{seealso}} rather than {{related}}
moving commented out "issues in defining feminism" to userspace [[User:Cailil/cailil sandbox 3]] - see talk
/* Heterosexual relationships */ rmv material on divorce rates - would be more appropriate on [[Divorce]] - see talk page
/* Poland */ added new section - this needs to be double checked the article it's summarized from as a lot of OR and POV problems
/* Men and feminism */ resizing pictures to fit section
/* Science and Feminism */ first attempt at a [[men and feminism]] summary - still needs a lot of work
info on ettinnger was pertinent to the article
very good addition to article, reinsert by good faith
harmonizing image sizes; and alphabetizing some categories (ones that are not ordered historically or developmentally)
/* 1970s - present */ reducing info on Ettinger as per [[WP:DUE]]; also reword for grammar, syntax and less jargon
/* Sex-positive feminism */ rmv info referencing a blog - please read [[WP:RS]], blogs are not sufficenr for verification on wikipedia
/* Heterosexual relationships */ some of this info from chapter 9, pages 187-195 ... (there is a lot of other very interesting stuff in this book relating to feminism if anyone is interested to add)

/* Notable feminists */ move list of famous feminists; rmv rest as redundant - link to list of feminists is at top of page
/* India and South Asia */ syntax and grammar
/* India and South Asia */ refs and reorganize last lines to assert fact rather than interpret without sources

undo addition by [[User:24.21.30.180]] the information added was not [[WP:RS|reliably sourced]], blogs are not acceptable as sources on wikipedia - if you have a reliable source please re-add the info
fixing reference conflict and a quick copy-edit
/* Anti-feminism */ further typo correction and further fix ref - thanks for pointing that out
/* Anti-feminism */ Wrong author name: Koerge --> Koertge
/* Riot Grrrl Feminism */ rmv red links

/* Scientific research into feminist issues */ renamed "Science and Feminism"

moving post-feminism onto the third wave section; absorbing contemp feminism into section

rv - is there a particular reason a reader would automatically conflate or confuse feminism and egalitarianism?
Feminism leans more toward women's rights and equality for women; it is not exactly Egalitarianism

rmv redundant wikitable with nothing in it
revert unused euphemism back to term commonly used in feminist circles
changed the politically charged word, 'mutilation' to the more nuetral word, 'cutting,' which is used as the title of the topic on wikipedia.
Changed "female genital mutilation," a politically charged phrase, into "female circumcision," a more nuetral, academic phrase.
/* Socialist and Marxist feminisms */ found a ref for the Zetkin and Marx idea of revolution myself; contextualized them a little as well
/* Socialist and Marxist feminisms */ pic of Clara Zetkin & Rosa Luxemburg

adding de Beauvoir to 'social construction' line in first paragraph of lead - see talk page

/* Radical feminism */ ifeminism, a pro-capitalist branch of anarcha-feminism
reverting Fephisto; anarchism refers to the traditional strain of anarchism and the reference uses it in this way; anarcho-capitalist is by definition a different term & different meaning. see talk
anarchism doesn't imply struggle against capitalism. See [[anarcho-capitalism]]
